intro: Anadenanthera peregrina, commonly known as the "Cupuaçu tree," is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The tree produces a fruit that contains a high amount of fatty acids and is used in various traditional and commercial applications. Its seeds are also used as a source of protein and have been studied for their nutritional value. The plant plays an important ecological role in the rainforest by contributing to soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.
